How can I use the `verifysignature` method to verify a signature in Verus?

You can use the `verifysignature` method to verify a signature by passing an object with the identity, message, and signature to the method. You can do this using the Verus command line interface or by making an RPC call using a tool like `curl`.

For example, using the Verus command line interface:
```
verus verifysignature '{"identity":"Verus Coin Foundation.vrsc@", "message":"hello world", "signature":"base64sig"}'
```

Or using `curl`:
```
curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "verifysignature", "params": [{"identity":"Verus Coin Foundation.vrsc@", "message":"hello world", "signature":"base64sig"}]}' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
```
